page.title: 03 Nuthall Temple
page.content: {NUTHALL TEMPLE}was a fine, richly decorated, Italian style mansion. It was built in 1754 for the Squire of the village Sir Charles Sedley who was M.P. for Nottingham. The Temple was a fantastic mansion. There were 9 best bedrooms,4 bathrooms and lots of other rooms. It had an octagonal hall and on the walls of the hall were carvings of Aesop's Fables, carved in plaster. There were 131 doors in the Temple. The Temple was the best house of its kind in the whole of England. The house had huge gardens with lots of trees from all around the world and a lake called{TEMPLE LAKE}. By 1927 the owners could not afford to keep it so all the decorations were sold and the house burned. In 1966 what was left of the house was buried under the{M1 MOTORWAY.
